evidence: Clear separation of concerns with distinct layers: context, exception, http, json, model, security, and util packages
Model layer is further divided into core and generated sub-layers indicating layered architecture
HTTP client functionality is isolated in http package with clear API client implementations
JSON serialization/deserialization is handled by dedicated json package with adapter pattern implementation
Context management is separated into its own package with clear responsibility for API context, user context, and session management
Exception handling is centralized in exception package with specific exception types
Security concerns are isolated in security package with encryption and signing functionality
Models follow a base class pattern (BunqModel) suggesting inheritance-based layering
Package structure shows clear horizontal separation with no circular dependencies evident
risks: High package count (18 packages) may indicate over-engineering for simpler use cases
Deep directory nesting (max depth 5) could complicate navigation and maintenance
Some packages like 'model/generated' suggest code generation which may increase complexity
